title.narrative: SWE-2011-89 Fiscal Capacity and Democracy in Developing Countries
SWE-2011-89 Fiscal Capacity and Democracy in Developing Countries

description.narrative: This project aims to fill a gap in the development economics literature by exploring the causal links between fiscal capacity and democracy in developing countries. To understand the relevant mechanisms, we study how these links are affected by natural disasters and foreign aid. We will conduct a set of studies at the cross-country, sub-national (in Kenya and India), and the household level (using public opinion surveys). This allows us to assess our research questions at the appropriate level of aggregation, using methods such as instrumental variables estimations and dynamic panel data regressions. We expect fiscal capacity and democracy to depend on and reinforce each other; and that the effect of aid-for-democratization may hinge on aid-for-fiscal capacity, and vice versa. Our results could lead to a re-evaluation of current aid development strategies.

This project aims to fill a gap in the development economics literature by exploring the causal links between fiscal capacity and democracy in developing countries. To understand the relevant mechanisms, we study how these links are affected by natural disasters and foreign aid. We will conduct a set of studies at the cross-country, sub-national (in Kenya and India), and the household level (using public opinion surveys). This allows us to assess our research questions at the appropriate level of aggregation, using methods such as instrumental variables estimations and dynamic panel data regressions. We expect fiscal capacity and democracy to depend on and reinforce each other; and that the effect of aid-for-democratization may hinge on aid-for-fiscal capacity, and vice versa. Our results could lead to a re-evaluation of current aid development strategies.
